result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron E Burklow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
If revoked, will allow to serve on home monitor after he has served the first 30 days in custody, if he qualifies.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $1,200 to West Side Mobil.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
No contact with West Side Mobil or Abdul or Seth Khan except write a letter of apology, give to the agent to approve and forward to the victim.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve entire 10 days on electronic monitor if he qualifies. 
Can serve his time in Waupaca County if arrangements can be made and counties agree. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron E Burklow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron E Burklow in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:16 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Atty Kuhl indicates the defendant would reserve his right to a restitution hearing.
Court questions Atty Kuhl. 
Atty Kuhl indicates the defendant does not wish to have a restitution hearing now.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kuhl makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
120 days jail, STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
If revoked, will allow to serve on home monitor after has served the first 30 days in custody, if he qualifies. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months:
Pay restitution of $1,200 to West Side Mobil. 
No contact with West Side Mobil or Abdul or Seth Khan except write a letter of apology, give to the agent to approve and forward to the victim. 
Serve 10 days in jail. 
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve entire 10 days on electronic monitor if he qualifies. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Can serve his time in Waupaca County if arrangements can be made and counties agree. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.

Attorney Brandon Kuhl in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:42 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins spoke with Atty Kuhl.  The defendant had transportation issues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
